description: The Planning, Protection and Optimization (PPO) module focuses on the practical application of PPO practices to enable capacity, availability, IT service continuity, information security and demand management. It is designed to develop organizations’ and individuals’ understanding of the ITIL Service Design processes and help ensure that new and updated services, service management systems and tools, technology architecture, processes and measurement systems, methods and metrics are designed to meet user needs and will require little further change once introduced.
descriptionMD: ** Look for our partner PassionIT Group's information [HERE](https://itprotv-notes-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/ITIL_OVERVIEW.zip)  Codes for offers are available to members and in the download in the second episode** The Planning, Protection and Optimization (PPO) module focuses on the practical application of PPO practices to enable capacity, availability, IT service continuity, information security and demand management. It is designed to develop organizations’ and individuals’ understanding of the ITIL Service Design processes and help ensure that new and updated services, service management systems and tools, technology architecture, processes and measurement systems, methods and metrics are designed to meet user needs and will require little further change once introduced. For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please [contact PassionIT Group](mailto:info@passionitgroup.com).
name: Accredited ITIL Intermediate - PPO
subtitle: Planning, Protection and Optimization

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry give a general overview of what to expect in the upcoming ITIL PPO series. They cover topics like who is the intended audience, what the scope of the series will cover, and what are some specific topics that will be addressed.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.008 --> 00:00:04.924
[SOUND]
>> In this segment, we're

2
00:00:04.924 --> 00:00:08.994
gonna take a brief look at what you can
expect from our upcoming ITIL PPO series,

3
00:00:08.994 --> 00:00:11.580
and joining us in the studio is Mr.
Terry Decker.

4
00:00:11.580 --> 00:00:14.260
Terry, can you give us
a brief introduction or

5
00:00:14.260 --> 00:00:17.390
just an overview of what we
can expect in that series?

6
00:00:17.390 --> 00:00:22.342
>> Well, PPO, Planning Protection &
Optimization is one of the capability

7
00:00:22.342 --> 00:00:26.036
modules designed by the ITIL
accredited curriculum and

8
00:00:26.036 --> 00:00:28.090
it focuses on five processes.

9
00:00:29.220 --> 00:00:32.480
Capacity management, availability
management, continuity management,

10
00:00:32.480 --> 00:00:35.190
security management and demand management.

11
00:00:35.190 --> 00:00:39.060
Those five processes, four of them
that is, come from service design,

12
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.140
one of them comes from service strategy.

13
00:00:41.140 --> 00:00:45.520
And it looks at those in a combined way;
how they interact with each other, and

14
00:00:45.520 --> 00:00:49.110
dives deep into the specific
activities of each of those processes.

15
00:00:49.110 --> 00:00:49.620
>> Excellent, now,

16
00:00:49.620 --> 00:00:53.975
could you give us an idea of who the
intended audience for this exam would be?

17
00:00:53.975 --> 00:00:58.295
Well, one, yeah, one key audience
member is going to be someone

18
00:00:58.295 --> 00:01:02.125
perhaps on the path of getting
their ITIL expert credential.

19
00:01:02.125 --> 00:01:04.835
This is a capability module,
it's worth four credits, so

20
00:01:04.835 --> 00:01:09.175
if you pass that exam you get four credits
toward the collection of credits you need

21
00:01:09.175 --> 00:01:13.355
to sit the Capstone exam which is called,
Managing Across the Life Cycles.

22
00:01:13.355 --> 00:01:17.500
So four credits await with successful
completion of the exam and

23
00:01:17.500 --> 00:01:20.650
operationally speaking, the audience
is gonna be those that are involved in

24
00:01:20.650 --> 00:01:24.530
strategic and design activities for
the IT service organization.

25
00:01:24.530 --> 00:01:27.440
So demand management
plays out in strategy,

26
00:01:27.440 --> 00:01:31.470
the other four play out in design as
relates to planning, protection and

27
00:01:31.470 --> 00:01:34.980
optimization, you really are trying
to build effective services

28
00:01:34.980 --> 00:01:40.230
that are resilient to change, and
are capable of growing with the business.

29
00:01:40.230 --> 00:01:45.002
So business focus, service designed
activities is the primary focus of PPO.

30
00:01:45.002 --> 00:01:49.392
>> Excellent, and now we have an idea
of who might be watching this.

31
00:01:49.392 --> 00:01:52.670
Obviously, there's exam takes
who are part of that group.

32
00:01:52.670 --> 00:01:56.130
When it comes to the exams, could you
give us an idea of what is like to

33
00:01:56.130 --> 00:02:00.120
get registered or just what it's
gonna be like to take the exam.

34
00:02:00.120 --> 00:02:05.390
>> Well, I'm here, I represent PassionIT
Group which is a portal passionitgroup.com

35
00:02:05.390 --> 00:02:08.490
you can go there and get information
about exams at a very specific level,

36
00:02:08.490 --> 00:02:13.000
you can order your exam vouchers there at
a discount and through PassionIT Group,

37
00:02:13.000 --> 00:02:16.780
you also get access to other
resources like course materials.

38
00:02:16.780 --> 00:02:19.370
As you sign up for this course,
as you're taking the curriculum,

39
00:02:19.370 --> 00:02:23.630
there is a wealth of information
in a zip file that has exam prep,

40
00:02:25.280 --> 00:02:29.690
activities, knowledge check activities,
as well as specific instructions for

41
00:02:29.690 --> 00:02:32.930
how you get those vouchers ordered and
how you get your exam scheduled.

42
00:02:32.930 --> 00:02:36.290
The exam itself is a little bit different
than the foundation exam If you've

43
00:02:36.290 --> 00:02:39.770
had an intermediate Excel book exam
before you'll find it very similar.

44
00:02:39.770 --> 00:02:43.230
They're scenario based questions,
only eight of them, and

45
00:02:43.230 --> 00:02:47.930
they're gradient scoring, meaning that one
answer will give you five points of value.

46
00:02:47.930 --> 00:02:51.690
Another answer will give you three,
other answers will give you less, right?

47
00:02:51.690 --> 00:02:53.590
So you've got to pick a better answer.

48
00:02:53.590 --> 00:02:55.150
You're analyzing things.

49
00:02:55.150 --> 00:02:58.350
So these intermediate level
exams are not rote memorization,

50
00:02:58.350 --> 00:03:01.620
they are taking knowledge and applying it,
which make it pretty fun actually.

51
00:03:01.620 --> 00:03:02.470
>> Very, very cool.

52
00:03:02.470 --> 00:03:04.809
Well Terry, we do thank you for
that information and

53
00:03:04.809 --> 00:03:07.309
if that sounds like something
that might interest you,

54
00:03:07.309 --> 00:03:09.722
we look forward to seeing
you in the up coming series.

55
00:03:09.722 --> 00:03:13.284
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry take a moment to give you a brief overview of what you can expect from the ITIL PPO exam. Here they cover topics like exam question formats, study materials, and practice exams.
episodes.title: Setup, Logistics and Expectations

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry take time to review the ITIL Foundation content as the PPO exam leans heavily on that knowledge base. Here they quickly walk through the pertinent terms and concepts used in the PPO exam.
episodes.title: Foudation Refresher

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry take time to review the ITIL Foundation content as the PPO exam leans heavily on that knowledge base. Here they quickly walk through the pertinent terms and concepts used in the PPO exam.
episodes.title: Foundation Refresher Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry provide a high-level review of the purpose, scope, and value of the Service Design lifecycle stage as it relates to the processes discussed in PPO. Topics covered include Service Strategy, Service Design, and Design Coordination.
episodes.title: The Service Design Context of PPO

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss Capacity Management which helps you understand, analyze, and discuss how to increase quality assurance for introducing and modifying services that are fit-for-purpose and/or fit-for-use.
episodes.title: Capacity Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss Capacity Management which helps you understand, analyze, and discuss how to increase quality assurance for introducing and modifying services that are fit-for-purpose and/or fit-for-use.
episodes.title: Capacity Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore Availability Management. Here they take the time to help you understand, analyze, and discuss how Availability Management should be conducted to contribute to quality assurance for introducing services that are fit-for-purpose and fit-for-use.
episodes.title: Availability Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore Availability Management. Here they take the time to help you understand, analyze, and discuss how Availability Management should be conducted to contribute to quality assurance for introducing services that are fit-for-purpose and fit-for-use.
episodes.title: Availability Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore Availability Management. Here they take the time to help you understand, analyze, and discuss how Availability Management should be conducted to contribute to quality assurance for introducing services that are fit-for-purpose and fit-for-use.
episodes.title: Availability Management Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore IT Service Continuity Management. Here they take the time to help you understand, analyze, and discuss how ITSCM should be conducted to contribute to quality assurance for introducing services that are fit-for-purpose and fit-for-use.
episodes.title: IT Service Continuity Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore IT Service Continuity Management. Here they take the time to help you understand, analyze, and discuss how ITSCM should be conducted to contribute to quality assurance for introducing services that are fit-for-purpose and fit-for-use.
episodes.title: IT Service Continuity Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore Information Security Management. Here they take the time to help you understand, analyze, and discuss how Information Security Management should be conducted to contribute to quality assurance for introducing services that are fit-for-purpose and fit-for-use.
episodes.title: Information Security Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore Demand Management. Here they take the time to help you understand, analyze, and discuss how Demand Management should be conducted to contribute to quality assurance for introducing services that are fit-for-purpose and fit-for-use.
episodes.title: Demand Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry cover technology implementation as part of implementing service management process capabilities and what special technology functions and features are related to Planning, Protection, and Optimization practices.
episodes.title: Technology and Implementation Considerations

episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over four sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Planning Protection and Optimization section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry and Zach cover the first four questions.
episodes.title: Sample Paper Review

episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over 4 sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Planning Protection and Optimization section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry & Zach cover questions 5 through 8, and offer a direction to PassionITGroup.Com & Deckerheads@yahoo.com.
episodes.title: Sample Paper Review Part 2
